tt:div.tt:p: CASTEAU: Why do I seem annoyed?
Let's see...

Instead of savoring this
espresso,
this cigarette,

and the exactly four minutes
of free time I have today,
I'm talking to you cockwits.
What else?

Oh, tonight I'm doing
a special seating for a bunch
of diplomats from the

State Department
and Albania.

So not only do I have
to create a meal out of yogurt
and a goddamn

sheep's head, apparently
there's been some vague security
threat, so my highly-trained
staff...
Has been infiltrated!
LANA: Sorry...
CASTEAU: By Shithead Squadron.

LANA: Just need to grab some
menus, for --
the camera, why is there a
camera?

CASTEAU: I assume because this
restaurant can't hold
three million viewers?

INTERVIEWER (O.S.):
Two-point-eight.

CASTEAU: Because it's not
promoted properly!

LANA: This is gonna be
televised?!

INTERVIEWER (O.S.): Yeah, the
show's called Bastard Chef?
LANA: Mm.
Scuse me.

CASTEAU: Thank you,
giraffe-lady!

Anyway, those
ISIS idiots are doing security,
and for some inexplicable reason

they have to do that undercover,
so -
[METAL BOWL HITS FLOOR]

WONG WONG WONG
WONGWONGWONGWONGWONGWONGWONGWONG
WONGWONGWONG...
ARCHER (O.S.): Whoops.

CASTEAU: That's probably why I
seem annoyed.

ARCHER: Let's go Chet, c'mon,
chop chop.

CYRIL: You're the one who
dropped it, why
do I have to clean it up?

ARCHER: Because you're the
gar√ßon de cuisine,
which means kitchen boy, whereas

I am the sous chef,
which means shut
your face and mop up the damn
yogurt.

CYRIL: And why do you get to be
sous chef?

ARCHER: Because I have fine
dining experience!
I used to own a restaurant.
CYRIL: It was a burger joint!
ARCHER: Cyril?
I mean Chet?
LANA (O.S.): Archer?
ARCHER: She means Randy.
LANA: Can I borrow you?
ARCHER: Sure, Mitzi.
LANA: My name is not Mitzi.
Walk-in.
Now.

ARCHER: Yeah, I got time for a
quickie.
CYRIL: Wait, a what?
Arch -- Randy!
Whoaaa, whoaaa...
ungh!

(sighs)
You guys can edit that out,
right?
INTERVIEWER (O.S.): Yes.
But we won't.

LANA: So, quick question, do you
think it's a good
idea to be talking to a
TV crew when we're undercover?

ARCHER: Fake names, duh,
follow-up question,
do you know how TV actually
works?

LANA: I --
ARCHER: They're not gonna
broadcast this

episode in this restaurant
tonight!
Wait, are you guys?

INTERVIEWER (O.S.): No, we --
ARCHER: Like a closed-circuit
deal, or...?
INTERVIEWER (O.S.): No.

ARCHER: Because come to think of
it, I don't
know how TV actually works
either.
LANA: How about geopolitics?
ARCHER: Eh...

LANA: Because if anything goes
wrong tonight,
US-Albanian relations could

become even more unstable, so --
CASTEAU (O.S.): What the shit?!

ARCHER: Speaking of unstable --
-- that guy is a powder keg.

CASTEAU: Why is there yogurt
frickin' soup all
over my spotless frickin'
kitchen?!
CYRIL: Randy did it.

ARCHER: Whoa whoa, first of all,
no I didn't,
and second, these bowls are the
worst!

ARCHER: Look, they're like,
totally slipper --
WONG WONG WONG

WONGWONGWONGWONG
WONGWONGWONGWONG
WONGWONGWONG...
LANA (O.S.): Seize, please hold.
Seize, please hold.

LANA: Seizepleasehold
seizepleasehold!
seizepleasehold!
Rrrg!
CASTEAU: What're you doing?

LANA: Well I'll tell you what
I'm not doing --
CASTEAU: Besides your job?

LANA: My job, is --
CASTEAU: Answering the damn
phone.

A task so simple that if
the health department
would let me, I'd have a monkey
do it.
LANA: Why?

CASTEAU: No, I was obviously
being facetious.

I would never allow a monkey in
my restaurant.

Except maybe in the form
of an exquisitely prepared
entr√©e.

LANA: No, I mean you're booked
solid for...
Holy shit, the next ten months?

So why even bother
answering the phone?

CASTEAU: To tell people they
can't eat here.

LANA: So, to drive people away,
basically.
CASTEAU: Those people.

That's not even the
real phone number for
reservations.
LANA: I'm sorry?

CASTEAU: The real number's a
secret.

Closely guarded by people I deem
acceptable.

LANA: So, just so I'm clear,
instead of
assessing the security needs for

tonight, I'm answering phone
calls
from people who aren't good

enough
to eat here in the first place.

CASTEAU: Yeah, so try to sound
apologetic,
but not, ya know, overly so.
LANA: Seize.

I'm sorry, we have nothing
available
for the next ten months.
Mmmkaybye.
CASTEAU: Keep trying.
CHERYL/CAROL (O.S.): Ugh, why?
MALORY: Besides I said so?
CHERYL/CAROL: They're booked.

MALORY: If I'd known I couldn't
get a table I'd have never
agreed to do security!

PAM: Why do they need security
anyway?

MALORY: There was a... threat,
of some sort, it's all rather
vague,

but when those
State Department dweebs see just
how good ISIS really is, mark my
words...

one day soon we'll be a major
player.

CHERYL/CAROL & PAM:
[suppressed chuckling]
MALORY: What.

CHERYL/CAROL: No, you know,
just...

PAM (still chuckling): You say
that like you believe it.
Wh-? Hey!
MALORY: Get me a table.
Or the fish gets it.

PAM: [huge, explosive sob]
CHERYL/CAROL: Jesus, what's the
big deal?

PAM: That's my fish,
his name's Jermaaaine!
CHERYL/CAROL: Oh.
I thought he was just your food.
CASTEAU (O.S.): Food?!
We're not making food, people!
We are creating cuisine!
Food is what a dog eats!
Or a tourist!

ARCHER: Wait, a dog ate a
tourist?
What!
That was ambiguously worded!
CYRIL: Gnfgh!
CASTEAU: Was that ambiguous?!
CYRIL: Why?
Are you antagonizing him?

ARCHER: Cyril,
c'mon, it's my nature. See?
Yeah, kinda!

CASTEAU (O.S.): Well how about
this?!
CYRIL: Gnfgh!

ARCHER: Plus he can't aim for
shit, he's
pulling everything to the right.

CASTEAU: And if you can't turn
that into promo
gold, you should honestly
consider suicide.
Hang on, there's a bumper.
Now prep, you [BEEEEEP] maggots!

And then bleep out [BEEEEEP],
since
Darlene won't let me say that.

But seriously guys, we do have a
lot of food to prep, so...

ARCHER: Uh, the food's
spalttered all over the
wall and floor and...

Chet here, so --
CASTEAU: So scoop it into a
bowl.

Nobody'll
know, it's Albanian glop,
the entr√©e's
a frickin sheep face.

I value all cultures equally
highly.

GILLETTE: Should you be smoking
in here?

CASTEAU: Should you be flaming
in here?
GILLETTE: Ya know...
CASTEAU: Boom! Bumper!

GILLETTE (about to cry): He's
just such a... bastard!
Wh-?
And that's not my name!

ARCHER: Yeah, "Child-Murderer"
shouldn't be hyphenated,
that makes it seem like

he's a murderer who's also a
child.

INTERVIEWER (O.S.): Actually no,
it doesn't --
ARCHER: Actually yes, it does.

"Publicity whore"
isn't hyphenated, so why --
CASTEAU: Why the shit?!
Are you maggots!
Not prepping?!

ARCHER: I -- wait,
are you doing a bumper?

SEXY ANNOUNCER (V.O.): Coming
up, on Bastard Chef!
CYRIL: Aaaaaagh!
GILLETTE: Aaaaaaagh!

ARCHER: I have seriously never
been happier.
Aaaaaagh!
ARCHER (O.S.): Boom, bumper.

LANA (O.S.): Wait, so what'd
Malory say exactly?

ARCHER: I -- she said "credible
threat."

LANA: I know, but what kind of
credible --
ARCHER: Cyr -- Chet!
I need those onions!
CYRIL (O.S.): Yes, chef!
ARCHER: Ha!
He has to call me chef.

LANA: How and why are you
enjoying this?

ARCHER: Well for one thing I'm
pretty drunk.

And besides bartending in
Polynesia,
I've never had a real job, so --
LANA: Wait, never?
ARCHER: Uh...

oh, when I was ten I asked if
I could sell "Grit" door to
door, so I could win
some of those x-ray specs?
But Mother said they were fake.

And also that I'd get raped and
murdered.

LANA: It is like peeling an
onion with you.
ARCHER: Right?
Oh wait.
Chet!
Onions!
CYRIL: Here.
What dish are they going in?
CYRIL: Oh eat a dick!
ARCHER: That's eat a dick, chef!

And for a third thing, I think I
actually might be good at this.

CASTEAU: Okay, yeah, nice
technique, Randy.
ARCHER: Thank you, chef.

Want me to prep
the 'shrooms?

CASTEAU: No I got these, you do
the aubergines.
ARCHER: Right away, chef.

If Chet gets his incompetent
thumb
out of his equally incompetent
ass!

CASTEAU: Nice, yes, that is
excellent A.B.B.A.B.

ARCHER: Always Be Berating And
Belittling.
CASTEAU: And you.

Time to lean, time to get
your distracting tits off my
line.

ARCHER: Hey, is something
burning?

Oh wait, it's you,
because you just got burned.

LANA: I -- oh my God, you admire
that dick.

ARCHER: He's a master chef,
Lana.

Which turns
out is not nearly as gay a job
as I thought it was.

I mean it's no secret
agent, but it's way above
architect.

LANA: Speaking, of secret agent,
at some point
before the restaurant is full

of diplomats, I'd love to go
over the --
ARCHER: Menu, I know, let's --
LANA: Plan!

ARCHER: On going over the menu,
yes.

Get child murderer
Gilles de Rais in here
and I'll walk you through it.

CASTEAU (O.S.): Answer the
goddamn phone, woman!

ARCHER: Seriously, Mitzi, how
hard is that?
CHERYL/CAROL: Rrgh!
Now nobody's picking up!

A monkey could do this stupid
job!

MALORY (O.S.): And yet I pay you
to do it.

CHERYL/CAROL: Oh, so now I'm a
monkey?!

MALORY (O.S.): No, because a
monkey --
CHERYL/CAROL (O.S.): Hoo ooo ooo
ooo eee eee eee eee!
LANA: What is this, Spain?

CHERYL/CAROL: I mean, it is just
constant A.B.B.A.B.
Is that supposed to funny?
PAM: Yes.

And also I think you might
have low blood sugar.

PAM: And I need you to focus, so
we can
get Cruella de Vil's mom in

there
a damn table before she kills
Jermaine!

CHERYL/CAROL: It's
immpoossiibllle.

And what's so
important about a stupid
goldfish?

PAM: Okay A, he's not a
goldfish, and B --
CHERYL/CAROL: Please don't
berate me.

PAM: Please don't make me, and
B...

PAM: Tell 'em Thuy
THUY: Toi ca voi ban nam ngan!

Con ca Jermaine se
giet con ca cua ban!

VIETNAMESE MEN: Jermaine,
Jermaine, Jermaine!

PAM: Anyhoo, without gettin all
into the details,
I may or may not owe

fourteen thousand dollars
to some people
you wouldn't wanna owe
fourteen cents.

CHERYL/CAROL: I so can't relate
to that.
PAM: Could you try?
CHERYL/CAROL: No.
PAM: Could you pretend to try?
CHERYL/CAROL: Yes!
CYRIL (O.S.): Absolutely not.

ARCHER: Absolutely yes, Chet,
c'mon I need
the tongues first, and then

every bit of meat scraped
off those cheeks.
CYRIL: Is that all?
You don't want the...
frickin eyeballs?!
ARCHER: Oh.
Okay, so the tongues second...

CYRIL: I'm not cutting out their
eyeballs!

ARCHER: Well not with that, use
a melon baller.

CYRIL: I --
ARCHER: Ooh!

I'm gonna go make a big pitcher
of melon balls.
You want one?

CYRIL: No I don't want a damn
melon ball!
ARCHER: Suit yourself.

But trust me, you
are gonna want a melon baller.

ARCHER: Okay, what's the word,
how we doing?

LANA: Well I've swept the entire
place for explosives,
and it's clear.
That's the good news.

The bad news is, if
this vague threat is gunmen,
we've

got ingress points here, here,
and...

You are talking about
eggplants.

ARCHER: No Lana, I'm talking
about aubergines.

LANA: They're the --
CASTEAU: They're the same thing.
ARCHER: Oh.
Then where does auberge fit in?

LANA: En nulle part, imb√©cile,
parce qu'un auberge
est un petit h√¥tel!

CASTEAU: Ahh, tu parles
fran√ßais?
LANA: Ouai.

CASTEAU: Then go answer the
goddamn phone!

LANA: [low growl]
CASTEAU: Okay, moment of truth,
taste test.

ARCHER: Please don't B-and-or-B
me too hard...
CASTEAU: Mm!
Not bad, Randy, not bad at all!
ARCHER: Thank you, chef.

CASTEAU: Just needs a little
kick in the ass.

Oh, and speaking of, where is
Chet?

ARCHER: In the walk-in, weeping
like a child.

CYRIL: [explosive sob]
CASTEAU: Nice!
Man, you shoulda been a chef.
ARCHER: Ohh...
pshaw.
CASTEAU: I'm serious.

I mean, maybe being a
secret agent isn't your true
calling.

ARCHER: Yeah, my Mother says
that a lot...

MALORY: Oh what, so now I
suppose you're
just going to sit there and
pout?!

MALORY: Well I didn't get you
into this, mister!
You got yourself into this!

And the clock is ticking,
my friend.

RODNEY: So, just so I'm
clear...

You want me to use this
top-secret
934-TX telephonic isolator unit,

for which you have neither the
clearance nor
the written permission to even

gaze upon, to find all
phone numbers
associated with this
physical address.

PAM: Yeah, Gilda Gotrocks here
says ritzy
joints like Seize have

reservation numbers
that're strictly on the QT.

CHERYL/CAROL: What is this,
Spain?
I mean the Thirties?

RODNEY: A flagrant violation of
my sworn
duty, for which my

recompense will be,
if in fact I heard you

PAM: Yes, you in fact did, and

will in fact be a handjob.
RODNEY: No.
PAM: From her.
RODNEY: Yes!
CHERYL/CAROL: Wh-?!
No!
PAM: Yes!
Please!

C'mon, if I don't
make good on that last
fish-fight,

you're gonna find me in a
dumpster
somewhere way out in Red Hook!

Ya know,
if you're ever in Red Hook
snoopin around in random
dumpsters.

CHERYL/CAROL: Great, so it's
give him a handjob or
change up my whole Sunday

PAM: Um... apparently.

CHERYL/CAROL: Ugh, this is so
unfair.
Okay...

CHERYL/CAROL: But I am not
spitting in your face.

RODNEY: I --
CHERYL/CAROL: Take it or leave
it.
CASTEAU: Mmmyello?
See how I did that?

Just pick up the phone
and talk into it?

LANA: I --
CASTEAU: And how did you get
this number?
Which Kennedy.

Because if it's Teddy
he still owes me for a urinal,
so --
oh.
Oh.
Yes, absolutely.

Eight o'clock,
table for four,
thank you.

RODNEY: Thank
yoooooooooooooouaaaagh...
RODNEY: Thank you.

CHERYL/CAROL: Hoo ooo ooo ooo
eee eee eee eee!

RODNEY: I think I'm --
CHERYL/CAROL: Ptoo!
RODNEY: -- in love with you.

PAM:(weary sigh)
And yet I will die alone.
TOGETHER: Yeah, probably.
CASTEAU (O.S.): Okay, listen up!

Tonight has to go
perfectly, because
it is wall to wall VIP's out
there.

We've got the
Albanian ambassador
and all his little diplomat
buddies...

CASTEAU (O.S.): And also Little
Vernie Kennedy, JFK's
crazy niece or cousin or
something.

CHERYL/CAROL: (posh accent,

And then Teddy walks into the

library wearing nothing
but a whiskey sour!

PAM: (chuckling)
Oh, Teddy.
Such a scamp.
CASTEAU: So no screw ups!
Now get to work!
Talking to you, Gayvid Niven!

GILLETTE: Oh, eat a di --
CASTEAU: What was that?
GILLETTE: Yes, chef!
CASTEAU: Randy, ready the soup.

I'll be out front,
favoring the guest of
honor with an aperitif
and my presence.

GILLETTE: And here you are,
Mr. Ambassador...

ALBANIAN AMBASSADOR: I prefer to
be called Your Excellency.

GILLETTE: Well, people in hell
want ice water.
LANA: (whisper) Ray!
LANA: What is your problem?!

GILLETTE: Besides not knowing if
I should add
an eighteen percent gratuity?

Because I can, it's a party of
six or more,
but if they were gonna tip

twenty percent,
I just hosed myself.

LANA: Not to mention US-Albanian
relations.

So instead of insulting the
ambassador, whom we're here to
protect --
GILLETTE: Protect him from what?

The only threat around here is
--
MALORY: Dying of thirst,
apparently.

I've been trying to get
a table at Seize
for months and when I finally

do, instead of Casteau's
world-famous
risotto, I have to eat sheep

face --
LANA: Wait a minute...

MALORY: -- so for God's sake,
the least you can do
is keep my wine glass full!
LANA: Oh my God, it's you!
You're the threat!

You couldn't get a table so
made an anonymous
threat and then got
ISIS hired to do security!

MALORY: Well that's still no
excuse for poor service.
GILLETTE: Wow.
LANA: Okay, you know what?
Excuse me!

MALORY: Yes, tell them all about
it. That'll do wonders
for US-Albanian relations.
LANA: Bon appetit!

CASTEAU: Hi, yeah, are you done
shouting at my guests
in barely-passable French?
LANA: (weary sigh) Oui.

CASTEAU: Then go help Mincent
Price with the --
KA-KLONG!
WONG WONG KLANK!
ARCHER (O.S.): Eighty-six soup!

CASTEAU: [weary sigh]
PAM: Aww man, I'm frickin

RON CADILLAC: Here ya go, gang,
get in here.

I brought a buncha
crackers and jelly.

MALORY: You promised you'd stop

RON CADILLAC: They were in my

MALORY: For the love of God,
will you --
Kicked out in the first act.

PAM: What?

CASTEAU: Tell Randy, as his

I walk back into the kitchen and

murder him with his own shoes,
to --
GILLETTE: Fire the entr√©es!
ARCHER (O.S.): Rrrrgh!
LANA: Yeah, might as well.

Because, Randy --
except, of course, for your
mother --
there is no threat.

ARCHER: Tell that to my tave
kosi!

The tender
flesh of which I'm now ruining
under

the broiler, because I have no

Now get --
-- back here and mop it up,

Plenipotentiary of

And to a long, peaceful,

between

Gezuar!

The dolma,
the rakia...
I feel I am home in Albania.

good.
Cyril and/or Chet?

CYRIL: No, Cyril and Chet are

couldn't hate both of them more.

Now get these entr√©es to the

Move, maggots,
everybody take a tray!
EVERYBODY: Yes, chef!
Right away, chef!
CASTEAU: Not you, Chet.

You look like a

Boom!
Bumper!
I am just killing it today.
MALORY: Well finally...

LANA: Yeah, sorry, we were
dealing with
this incredibly obnoxious hoax,

ALBANIAN AMBASSADOR: Mmmm!

I -- grk!

EVERYBODY [reactions of

ARCHER: Wow, you really do like

To poison!
ARCHER: What?!

Pam!
